alert.note: Alert for Central Tularosa Basin (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 5:21PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Otero and eastern Sierra Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 521 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Three Rivers, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Otero and eastern Sierra Counties. This includes Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 99 and 100. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
